instrument.name: Trombone
instrument.description: The trombone is easily recognisable by its distinctive use of a hand-operated slide held out in front, in order to change pitch.

instrument.name: Trumpet
instrument.description: One of the most ancient of all instruments. Played horizontally via a series of valves on the top of the instrument.

instrument.name: Tuba
instrument.description: The piston valve action is similar to the trumpet, only the valves themselves are situated in the middle of the instrument.

instrument.name: Flute
instrument.description: A normally silver-plated (or in more extravagant cases, gold), narrow-bored instrument, held horizontally just under the mouth.

instrument.name: Violin
instrument.description: The violin typically has four strings and it is most commonly played by drawing a bow across its strings.

instrument.name: Guitar
instrument.description: Very popular string instruments. It usually has six strings, but there are also guitars with four or twelve strings.

instrument.name: Saxophone
instrument.description: The saxophone was designed around 1840 by Adolphe Sax, a Belgian instrument maker, and first gained popularity in military bands.

instrument.name: Oboe
instrument.description: A narrow-bored wooden instrument descended from the medieval shawm.

instrument.name: Piccolo
instrument.description: Higher pitched "cousin" of the flute. Very small and can produce incredibly high tones.

instrument.name: Piano
instrument.description: A large musical instrument, played by pressing black and white keys on a keyboard.
